page.title: 06Tourism in Willingham
page.content: The{Public Hall}was formerly a hospital but is now used mainly by the Scout and Guide movements. The{Church Hall}opposite the Parish Church is used by a play group each morning. The{Pump}on the Green was repaired and restored in 1966. The{Library}which faces onto the Green was formerly a Gas Showroom. The{Recreation Ground}includes play apparatus, a tennis court and a bowling green. At{Belsar's Hill}there is evidence of an{Iron Age fort.}It is on the line of the{Fen Causeway,}the ancient route between Cambridge and Ely. There is a derlict {windmill}in a field off Mill Lane. The{River Great Ouse}runs close to the village.
